intro: Oxyanthus laxiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered oxyanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Oxyanthus laxiflorus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
